page.title: 03MOBILITY AND FACILITIES.
page.content: We have about 17km. of metalled road and 2km. of tracks.There is only one short public footpath at Cork.Since 1965 two footpaths have been lost, because no one uses them.The County Council has bought the old rail track and soon it should be a public way. Anyone who drives fast on our roads is silly,as there are narrow places, dangerous bends and crossroads.There have been bumps,but luckily no serious accidents.Transport for shopping is a problem without a car,but we have a Post Office with general store and a shop at the chalet camp at Ruthern Bridge.A mobile shop covers most of the area.Milk is delivered every third day.There is a weekly visit from the Library van,meals on wheels,and a hospital car service.There are buses for shopping on Tuesday and Friday. Some older people use Bodmin taxis.
